input_text:
Job Title: Mastercam Programmer/Machinist

Location: Middletown, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production

Description:
Who We Are - Our CultureWhen you join Advanced Conversion Technology (ACT), you join:A team who proudly supports the United States military through solving problems and providing innovative solutions that protect our troops;A team laser focused on developing unique next-generation technology found on state-of-the-art military defense platforms;A growing, stable, 100% employee owned company in business for over 40 years;An environment that encourages teamwork, creativity and innovation; one where every employee is an integral part of our business; andA team on whom our customers rely to provide innovative solutions to stand up to their most demanding applications.
Job SummaryACT is seeking a strong CNC Machinist/Programmer with Mastercam programming experience as well as previous horizontal and vertical machining experience to program, set-up and operate our equipment. We have a strong mentorship program and believe strongly in collaboration between all departments and career development.
Hours are 7:00am-3:30pm, Monday through Friday.
Must Have QualificationsHigh school diploma/GED3-5 years training or equivalent commensurate combination of education and experience preferredDemonstrated ability to program with Mastercam requiredAbility to machine complex components with horizontal and vertical machining centersKnowledge of and experience with G&M codesDemonstrated foundation in geometric tolerancing and dimensionsBasic math skills including addition, subtraction, decimals and fractionsAbility to read blueprints and bills of materialComputer experience to include proficiency with Excel, Word, Outlook and ERP systemsGood organizational skills and attention to detailAbility to multitask
What's in it for you?100% Employee Ownership: Every member of the team shares in the company's financial success through the company-funded employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), but ownership means so much more to us at ACT. It's about communicating transparently, being accessible and empowering everyone to contribute their ideas.Bright Opportunities for Growth: ACT has experienced steady growth over the past five years and we have a plan to continue that growth in the decade to come. Our people are the foundation of that plan and we provide ample training and mentorship opportunities so you can continue to evolve your skills and take on new challenges.Comprehensive Benefits, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401K plan with company match, holidays and PTO.
For more information, please visit our website at https://www.actpower.com/careers/.
This position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations, i.e. the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of U.S. regulations as defined by ITAR.
ACT is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Mastercam Programmer/Machinist
output_json.summary: ACT is seeking a strong CNC Machinist/Programmer with Mastercam programming experience.
required_skills: Previous horizontal and vertical machining experience
Machine complex components with horizontal and vertical machining centers
Knowledge of and experience with G&M codes
Foundation in geometric tolerancing and dimensions
Basic math skills including addition, subtraction, decimals, and fractions
Reading blueprints and bills of material
Computer experience including proficiency with Excel, Word, Outlook, and ERP systems
Good organizational skills and attention to detail
benefits: Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401K plan with company match, holidays, and PTO
output_json.company_information: Advanced Conversion Technology (ACT) is a 100% employee-owned company in business for over 40 years. They focus on developing unique next-generation technology for state-of-the-art military defense platforms and support the United States military.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: ACT is an equal opportunity employer considering qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

other.content: This position may require exposure to information subject to US export control regulations.
